channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-12607] TestHBaseFsck#testParallelHbck fails running against hadoop 2.6.0
item.description:
TestHBaseFsck#testParallelHbck consistently fails on both Linux and Mac.
I added more logging as shown below:


    HBaseFsck h1 = hbck1.get();

    HBaseFsck h2 = hbck2.get();

    LOG.warn("h1: " + h1);

    LOG.warn("h2: " + h2);

I saw the following in test output:


2014-12-01 14:58:44,728 WARN  [main] util.TestHBaseFsck(576): h1: org.apache.hadoop.hbase.util.HBaseFsck@72aa738e

2014-12-01 14:58:44,729 WARN  [main] util.TestHBaseFsck(577): h2: org.apache.hadoop.hbase.util.HBaseFsck@186e2ce6

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
I ran into this back in October and have been trying to figure out how to disable the retrying caused by HDFS-6478.

No joy yet, but I got caught up in other things.

Patch that allows the test to pass based on hadoop 2.6.0

Still looking for a way to either disable the retry or making the retry timeout lower at hdfs level.
Without HDFS-6697, it seems not possible to configure custom timeout.

Sean Busbey:
What do you think of the patch ?

Sorry Ted, heads down trying to get HBASE-12522 unblocked.

Skimming, it looks like you're setting a timeout on the future that's short enough to fail for the retrying instance? My concern is that this will be testing that timeout and not that the underlying call properly died or blocked on the first instance completing.

As I stated above, there is no known solution which changes the timeout on DFCClient w.r.t. the retrying behavior.

Due to this limitation, test change seems the way to go.

This message is automatically generated.

One possible solution is for HBaseFsck to mark state as waiting to acquire lock before entering checkAndMarkRunningHbck().
A getter method would be added to HBaseFsck so that we can tell whether the running HBaseFsck instance is in waiting state.

In the test, having two instances of HBaseFsck is fine as long as one of them is in waiting state.

Sean Busbey: what do you think ?

In patch v2, fail checkAndMarkRunningHbck() if it took long to obtain lock.

Sean Busbey:
What do you think ?

This message is automatically generated.

The current code depends on a bug in hdfs which was fixed in hadoop 2.6.0

With the bug fixed, the second attempt at invoking hbck would keep on retrying until it can successfully create the lock file.

Proposed fix is to fail the second attempt since initiation of the second attempt overlaps the first invocation of hbck.
I will take a look at the patch later today.
Patch looks safe to me. +1.
+1. It would be nice if we used a FutureTask to timeout the attempt to get the lock rather than wait the whole period and then fail, but I'm fine with that being a follow-on.
Thanks for the reviews, Ram and Sean.
